summary:
Sildenafil, commonly known as Viagra, is a medicine used to help men with erectile dysfunction (trouble getting or keeping an erection) and high blood pressure in the lungs. It can also be used for Raynaud's phenomenon, a condition that affects blood flow to the fingers.

This drug works by relaxing blood vessels, making it easier for blood to flow, especially in the penis. It's taken by mouth, injection, or under the tongue. Side effects might include headaches and skin flushing. It's important to be careful if you have heart problems. Sildenafil was first made by Pfizer and is now available as a generic drug.
title: Sildenafil
